params.text:
Social Exchanges

Take Part in a Simple Conversation 2:

Language in Action

• Talk about your interests/leisure activities
  • Ask someone about their interests/activities
  • Talk about your experiences
Social Exchanges: Introduction

Ready to chat more with others? This module will give you the tools to have a longer and more interesting conversation! 

Here's what you'll learn:

1. Talk about your hobbies: Learn how to share what you enjoy doing in your free time.

  2. Ask about interests: Master how to ask someone about their hobbies and activities.

  3. Share your experiences: Become confident in talking about things you've done or places you've been.

dialogs.answer: This is a basic way to say what you enjoy doing.
This introduces what you like to do when you have free time.
This expresses a general interest in something.
This can be used to talk about a hobby or skill you're good at.
This lets someone know you've recently taken up a new hobby.

params.textField:
Ben: In my *free* time, I really *enjoy* playing sports, especially *basketball*. I play with some friends on weekends. What about you? Do you have any hobbies?
Alison: I'm *interested* in art. I enjoy painting in my free time, and I recently *started* taking a pottery class too. What about you?

params.text: Exercise:
Ask Someone About Their Interests - Flashcards
Please click on the flashcards to see useful phrases you can use to ask someone about their interests and hobbies:

dialogs.text: What do you like to do in your free time?
dialogs.answer: This is a general question to ask someone about their hobbies.
This is another way to ask someone about their interests.
This asks about someone's general interests.

dialogs.text: What do you like to do for fun?
dialogs.answer: This is a casual way to ask someone about their leisure activities.
This can be used to ask if someone enjoys a specific activity and has some skill in it.

metadata.title: Ask someone about their interests drag the words

params.text: Ask Someone About Their Interests - Sentences
Please listen to the conversation between Jemima and Ben, and answer the questions below:
Dialogue Text:

Jemima: Hi Ben! How was your weekend?

Ben: Hi Jemima, it was good thanks! What about you? Do you have any hobbies?

Jemima: Yes! I'm interested in photography. I enjoy taking pictures of nature, especially flowers and landscapes. What about you? What do you like to do for fun?

Ben: That's cool! I recently started learning photography too! In my free time, I also enjoy playing sports, especially basketball. I play with some friends on weekends.
Ben:
Ben:
Jemima:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What is Jemima interested in?
Question 2 of 3: What does Ben enjoy doing with his friends on weekends?
answers:
Playing basketball

Taking pictures 

Going to the movie

Reading books

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What did Ben recently start learning?
answers:
Photography

A new language 

How to play an instrument

How to cook

metadata.title: talking about experiences drag the words

dialogs.answer: Use past tense verbs like "went," "visited," "saw," etc. to talk about things did.
This introduces a new experience you had recently.
This specifies the time when something happened.
This expresses that you enjoyed an experience.

dialogs.text: "It was a bit difficult, but..."
dialogs.answer: This can be used to talk about a challenging experience, but then emphasize something positive.

Tarik:

params.textField:
Alison: Hi Tarik, how are you doing today?
Tarik: Hi Alison, I'm great! I had a weekend trip to the mountains. We went *hiking* and camping, it was fantastic!
Alison: Wow, that sounds amazing! *Did* you see any wildlife?
Tarik: Yes! We saw a few deer on one of our hikes. It was a bit *difficult*, but the fresh air and scenery were wonderful.
Alison: That sounds lovely. Last *weekend*, I *went* to a music festival with some *friends*. We had a great time listening to different music.
Tarik: How cool! What *kind* of music did they play?

params.text: Talk about your experiences - Forum & Quiz
You are reading an online forum about learning Spanish. Please read the posts, and answer the questions below:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Why did Alison decide to start learning Spanish?
answers:
She is going on vacation to Spain.

She wants to move to Spain.

She is taking a class.

She has a friend who speaks Spanish.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Tarik recommend as the best way to learn Spanish?
answers:
Living in a Spanish-speaking country

Using a language learning app

Taking a class at a college

Watching movies in Spanish

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What is Ben's goal for learning Spanish by the end of the year?
answers:
To have simple conversations

To become fluent

To read Spanish literature

To travel to South America

l10n.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
l10n.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.

params.text: Alison:
Ben:
Tarik:

Alison: Hi everyone! I recently decided to start learning Spanish because I'm going on vacation to Spain next summer. I use a language learning app and it’s really good! Does anyone have any other tips for learning Spanish?

Tarik: Hey Alison! Spanish is a beautiful language. I lived in Barcelona for a few years, so I learned Spanish when I was there. Living in a Spanish-speaking country is definitely the best way to learn, but using an app is a good start!
Ben: Hi everyone, I've been learning Spanish for a few months now. I'm taking a group class, and it's been a lot of fun!. I hope I can have simple conversations in Spanish by the end of the year.
Module Summary Quiz
Choose the BEST answer for each question to demonstrate your understanding of the key skills for concluding social exchanges effectively.

choices.question: Question 1 of 3:  How can you say you enjoy reading in your free time?
answers:
My hobby is reading.

I don’t read books in my free time.

I'm good at reading!

I recently started swimming.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What can you ask someone to find out about their hobbies
answers:
What do you like to do in your free time? 

What's the weather like today?

Are you married?

Where are you from originally?

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: How can you tell someone you had a difficult but enjoyable experience?
answers:
It was a bit difficult, but... 

It was an easy experience, but...

It was a fun experience!

It was very easy.
